member_organisations:
Ebenezer Emergercy Fund (30000), 
Christians for Israel International (100000), 
Shalom Europa (500)
fields_of_interest: Economy, finance and the euro, Budget, Trade, Culture, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Enlargement, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations
eu_initiatives: ECI is following all EU policies related to the Middle East, in particular policies related to the disputed territories. ECI also has a genuine interest in any initiatives and policies connected with the rise of anti-Semitism and xenophobia in Europe.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
goals__remit: ECI seeks to address the issue of growing anti-Semitism and anti-Zionism in Europe and inform members of European Parliament and other political leaders in Brussels and other European capitals about the complex realities of the conflict in the Middle East by acknowledging the right for Israel to exist within secure borders.
relevant_communication: In 2017 ECI hosted two major conferences in the European Parliament, in March ECI hosted its annual policy conference in the European Parliament on the topic of Jerusalem, cooperation or separation. In June ECI hosted a screening of a documentary on the 1967 war in conjunction with the 50th anniversary of the reunification of Jerusalem. In December ECI co-hosted a large seminar on the Balfour Declaration together with the ECPM (European Christian Political Movement). ECI is part of the European Parliament working group on anti-Semitism.
